814196634.given_title: Getting Started With the Pocket Developer API
814196634.resolved_title: Getting Started With the Pocket Developer API
814196634.excerpt: I want to automatically extract the video from my Pocketed content and sync it to my phone. To do this, I’ll need to extend Pocket via the Developer API. Here’s how to get started. Head over to the Pocket Developer Portal and create a new App.

3043513400.given_title: Performant data fetching with promises and Eleventy - Webstoemp
3043513400.resolved_title: Performant data fetching with promises and Eleventy
3043513400.excerpt: One of my older post is about fetching data from a GraphQL API with Eleventy. While the example code I wrote works, it does not retrieve data in a very performant way. The problem is that I use await in a while loop (like a dummy).

3344942275.given_title: Creating an 11ty collection from a JSON API - Mike Street - Lead Developer
3344942275.resolved_title: Creating an 11ty collection from a JSON API
3344942275.excerpt: 11ty is a fantastic static site generator. One of my favourite elements of it is Global Data files. These allow you to have local JSON and other formats and build collections out of them.

3368302294.given_title: Serverless—Eleventy, a simpler static site generator.
3368302294.excerpt: A plugin to run Eleventy in a serverless function for server side rendering (e.g. Previews in your CMS) and/or in very large sites with On-demand Builders. You can read more about serverless on the eponymous Serverless microsite from CSS-Tricks.

3494528344.given_title: Going serverless with Eleventy - LogRocket Blog
3494528344.excerpt: Using Eleventy alone can help you produce great static websites efficiently and boost performance. However, this does not work well when using dynamic data in your application.

3507243599.resolved_title: How To Use Vue To Template Your Eleventy Projects
3507243599.excerpt: Okay quick disclaimer before I kick this off — this post does not cover how to use interactive Vue components in an Eleventy project. This post covers using Vue entirely server-side! The client will not receive any Vue code. All of the code for this project can be found in this repo on GitHub.

3509592482.given_title: OpenGraph Image—Eleventy, a simpler static site generator.
3509592482.excerpt: Try it out on the Eleventy API Explorer.

3519116762.resolved_title: JavaScript “For” Loop Techniques You Might Not Know
3519116762.excerpt: Some of the “for loops” I’ve used in recent demo’s and rewrites for people have raised eyebrows.

3520720065.given_title: Programmatic API—Eleventy, a simpler static site generator.
3520720065.resolved_title: Eleventy is a simpler static site generator.
3520720065.excerpt: Eleventy v0.12.1 requires Node 10 or newer. Use node --version on the command line to find your local Node version. This will compile any files matching valid input template file extensions (.md is one of them) in the current directory into the output folder (defaults to _site).
